newsitem.title: USA: Maine to use state highway funds for ferry service.
newsitem.headline: Maine to use state highway funds for ferry service.

text.p: Maine's Attorney General has cleared the way to use state highway funds, including state and federal money dedicated to bridge improvements, to support ferries.
Until the ruling by the attorney general, Drew Ketterer, earlier this month, the Department of Transportation had assumed that it was unlawful to apply highway funds for that purpose.
Ticket prices for the ferry service have climbed sharply in the past few years, as state support has falled to 30 percent from 50 percent.
